attributes.comment:
Please reconsider raising the USCIS fees for adoption-related petitions. These
fees already represent a financial barrier to many families hoping to take in
children in need of a family, and to raise them further will prevent more
children from finding permanent homes. Adoption is already an extremely
expensive process, usually approaching $20,000 in costs or more, and although
potential adoptive families can do their best to keep costs down, the USCIS fees
apply in all situations--and families must of course pay the fees more than once
when adopting the very children who are hardest to place--sibling sets.

An increase in these fees will also be especially harmful to lower-income
families seeking to adopt. My family is already struggling to finance the
adoption of a child in need, and since we are lower income, we will not receive
the full benefit of the tax credits meant to help families. Since our citizens
and government have repeatedly affirmed that the adoption of children in need
into loving U.S. families is a good thing, please do not make this harder to
achieve by raising the adoption-related USCIS fees further. I understand that
due to concerns about security and immigration, the USCIS may be under pressure
to do more with less money at this time, but adoptive parents--and the children
waiting to join their families--should not be the ones to bear this burden.
Thank you.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Wendy Wetzel
